meanings.definition: To outdo in fumbling or making mistakes.
meanings.sent1: She outfumbled her friend in the game of juggling balls.
meanings.sent2: He always manages to outfumble his way through any task.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown outfumbled his own tricks, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Despite his efforts, he outfumbled his chances of winning the competition.
meanings.sent5: Her attempts to bake a cake were so disastrous, she outfumbled even the most experienced bakers.

meanings.definition: To surpass in clumsiness or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The new employee outfumbled his coworkers with his awkward movements.
meanings.sent2: Whenever he tries to dance, he always manages to outfumble his steps.
meanings.sent3: The magician outfumbled his own tricks, leaving the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the kitchen, she outfumbled her way through the recipe.
meanings.sent5: His attempts to fix the broken clock only resulted in further outfumbling the situation.
